alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Marshall; Pontotoc; Union (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 11:44PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lafayette, western Union, northwestern Pontotoc and southeastern Marshall Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1144 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Holly Springs National Forest, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Holly Springs National Forest, Cambridge, Harmontown, Etta, Springdale, Bethlehem, Tula, Denmark, Pinedale, Thaxton, Algoma, Myrtle, Abbeville, Taylor, Toccopola, Hortontown, Keel, Poolville and Esperanza. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northwestern Mississippi.
